title: Huldredrom: Dream of the Hid-Folk
description: "The soft crackling of a warm fire made night within the house a welcome creature. A time when one could stretch ones limbs and slip into the Morphean abyss of sleep and dreams... In this hour of silence, all things hunt for something they desire. So too was hunting the murky form that skulked behind the farmhouse...." Her mother said they were real-her husband said they were just fairytales-but when her newborn son is spirited away in the middle of the night, she realizes who was right. Raised high in the Rondane mountains by trolls and huldres, Vitholf knows that he is not human, but what can he do when he falls in love with a herd girl from the valley? Within the pages of "Huldredrom," author Christopher Knutson has recorded the eternal "Dream of the Hid-folk," a dream as old as the everlasting mountains-a dream that never dies...
author: Christopher R. Knutson
